column2: Acceptance Criteria: All personnel on site have been inducted to the CRG site
Record of conformity: Site induction signed.
1.2 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
Reference Documents: Project Drawings / Drawing Register
Record of conformity: Latest Revision Drawings
1.3 - Safety measures are in place, Safe Work Method Statement (SWMS) undertaken
Acceptance Criteria: As per Fulton Hogan Safety Strategy. All personnel on site to have signed onto relevant SWMS before commencing work.

Welding of splices in steel reinforcement, including to other steelwork and to continuity bar reinforcement, shall not commence until the welding procedure has been qualified and reviewed by the Superintendent.
Reference Documents: VicRoads CL611.14 AS1554.3 Section 4
Acceptance Criteria: Surfaces to be welded are free of corrosion & paint or any other foreign material that may effect the quality of the weld
Where reinforcing steel is to be assembled prior to welding, it shall
a) Bars are to be in the correct location
b) Before welding a butt splice, bars shall be not out of alignment by more than 0.1 times the diameter up to a max misalignment of 3mm
c) Parts to be spliced shall be into as close a contact as practical but not more than 0.25 times the diameter of the smaller bar but not more than 3mm
d) Tack weld, shall be subject to the same initial treatment (preheating). Tack weld that will be consumed in the final weld shall be cleaned. Defective tac weld shall be removed before final weld
Please refer to table 5.3 to determine if preheating is required
Grade 500N, bar size less than 40mm pre heating is NOT required
a) Temperature of the metal is colder than 0 degrees
b) Surfaces are wet. If surface can be dried pre heating is required to 20 degrees
c) During periods of high winds
Acceptance Criteria: Testing shall not be less than what is shown in Table 611.141
Table 611.141 Inspection and Quality of Direct Butt Splice Welds
Inspection Process || Minimum extent of inspection (% of welds, as no.) || Detail of inspection of direct butt splice welds || Quality requirements
Visual inspection || 100 || Each full weld circumference || AS/NSZ 1554.3, Table 6.2

Non-destructive internal inspection by Radiography || First two inspection lots :: 20 || with a minimum of 12 bars inspected per lot, and at least 6 of these 12 bars to be examined at two directions, at least 60 degrees apart || AS/NZS 1554.1, Table 6.2.1

Non-destructive internal inspection by Radiography || Subsequent inspection lots after first two :: 10 || If more than one weld in an inspection lot does not comply with the quality requirements, revert to extent of inpsection as for the first two inspection lots || AS/NZS 1554.1, Table 6.2.1
Non-destructive surface inspection by Magnetic particle, or Liquid penetrant || 5 || Each full weld circumference || AS/NZS 1554.3, Table 6.2
